replies.bodyText:
I like the original phrasing better, since it first tells you what it is, rather than starting off with the exact format.
Authorization roles to use for catalogs, specified as a list of key-value pairs for the
catalog and role. For example, ``catalog1:roleA;catalog2:roleB`` will set ``roleA``
for ``catalog1`` and ``roleB`` for ``catalog2``.

timeline.bodyText: A list of key-value pairs to set session properties globally and specifically for catalogs. The format for global properties is propertyname:value. Catalog-specific properties use the catalog name as a prefix catalog.propertyname:value. Multiple properties are separated by ;.

replies.bodyText:
Similarly, I like the original better.
Session properties to set for the system and for catalogs, specified as a list of key-value pairs.
For example, ``abc:xyz;example.foo:bar`` will set the system property ``abc`` to the value ``xyz``
and the ``foo`` property for catalog ``example`` to the value ``bar``.
